title: Man Utd transfer news: Scouts sent to watch Moussa Dembele AGAIN on Sunday night
text:
Manchester United sent scouts to watch Moussa Dembele on Sunday night — and they could be handed a boost after he was benched again.

They dispatched staff to take in Lyon's game against Saint-Etienne and saw the former Celtic man left out of the starting line-up by under pressure manager Sylvinho, who has frequently rotated his forward line this season.

Dembele did come on in the second-half and managed to hit Lyon's only shot on target of the game.

Manchester United scouted Lyon's Moussa Dembele on Sunday night but he was benched

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer needs attacking additions in January to improve Manchester United

There's a risk for Lyon that United will push for a cut-price deal in January due to Dembele dipping in and out of the side.

This despite the 23-year-old being just one goal behind Ligue 1's current top scorer Victor Osimhen.

Sportsmail has previously reported on United's interest in Dembele, who they view as a possible solution to their striking problem.

They have kept track of him all season as the six-goal striker has impressed for Lyon.

Dembele has impressed in front of goal while falling victim to Sylvinho's rotation policy

United have struggled for goals all campaign, scoring more than one in just one match — the 4-0 win against Chelsea on the opening day of the campaign.

On Sunday, they were humbled by Newcastle as they lost 1-0 against Steve Bruce's side at St. James' Park.

They need attacking additions in January after allowing Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez to leave in the summer window.

Saint-Etienne's fans celebrate their victory against fierce rivals Lyon on Sunday evening
description: EXCLUSIVE BY AMITAI WINEHOUSE: Manchester United dispatched staff to take in Lyon's game against Saint-Etienne and saw the former Celtic striker left out of the starting line-up.
